sentences.english: Supporting mutually old is not easy, whether or not the more this to cherish.
sentences.chinese: 相扶到老不容易，是否更该去珍惜。

sentences.english: Catching the old is not easy, whether it is more treasure to go.
sentences.chinese: 相扶到老不容易，是否更该去珍惜。

sentences.english: And I cherish this opportunity of being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 我珍惜这个被抨击的机会。

sentences.english: The most regrettable and Qu doesn't is to lose, but have, didn't cherish well.
sentences.chinese: 最遗憾啲并吥是失呿，而是拥有时，没有好好珍惜。

sentences.english: RHT Reinforced Heel even as well even as Toe;
sentences.chinese: 脚尖和脚跟都有加厚层珍惜。

sentences.english: They treasure their leisure with measureless pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 他们以无限的快乐珍惜他们的闲暇时间。

sentences.english: I cherished the memories I had, and the friends I had made, but this was all before the times of MSN and AOL chat programs.
sentences.chinese: 我珍惜这段回忆，和此时所交的朋友。

sentences.english: From now on, I will expect nothing, and just take what I get.
sentences.chinese: 以后刻起，我将不再等候，只珍惜我所拥有的。

sentences.english: I noticed and appreciated when she took quiet time by herself.
sentences.chinese: 我注意和珍惜小女儿安静地独自一人活动。

sentences.english: You had Lennon but you wasted him.
sentences.chinese: 你拥有了列农却没有珍惜他。

sentences.english: Don't read the past, not for the future, cherish now.
sentences.chinese: 不念过往，不为未来，珍惜现在。

sentences.english: My heart is haunted, a treasure and desire.
sentences.chinese: 心底，都是萦回着一份珍惜与渴望的。

sentences.english: One or two knew each other and conversed.
sentences.chinese: 认识了你，让我知道相互珍惜如此重要。

sentences.english: To sentiment reason which late comes, treasures well, no longer error predestined match.
sentences.chinese: 对迟来的情缘，好好珍惜，不再错失良缘。

sentences.english: What is innocence and why should it be cherished?
sentences.chinese: 天真无邪又是什么，为什么应该要珍惜赤子之心？

definition: to place great importance on/to treasure
precious/extremely valuable/(honorific) Please take good care of yourself!
content with one's situation/to know contentment (hence happiness)
to cherish/to treasure/to take care of/to love and protect
to constantly have (sb or sth) on one's mind
